reviews.text: This was a great botique hotel in a great San Jose neighborhood. We stayed our first and last nights of a ten day Costa Rican vacation at the Don Carlos and we are very pleased.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Jose

reviews.text: The hotel is charming and decorated with all kinds of Costa Rican art. We had two different rooms, and both were very clean. My only complaint is that they could use new mattresses. Both of our rooms had two double beds, and all four were worn out and would sink in a little. However, we both slept good both nights.
reviews.title: Charming and friendly
Not a run of the mill chain
reviews.text: The staff was great and very professional. They all spoke excellent English, as every guest we cam across was from the States. The breakfast was great.
They have the best gift shop we came across while in Costa Rica. There is a lot of variety there, and most items were cheaper than we could find elsewhere in the country.
reviews.title: People were great
Nice Hotel that is close to everything
reviews.text: We felt very safe in the neighborhood. We walked four blocks at night to a local restaurant. It's also only a six block walk to central San Jose, which we did at day and night, and felt safe the whole time.

I stayed for one night after arriving in Costa Rica. My room was charming and the hotel is within three blocks of two great restaurants - Bakea and Cafe Mundo - which is major draw. Staff was so helpful -Breakfast is included in the room rate but my tour was picking me up too early to take advantage of it so I stopped at the little restaurant in the lobby and they gave us juice and tea gratis.
reviews.title: Charming hotel

reviews.text: On a recent trip to Costa Rica. Pedro at the front desk was very friendly and service is exceptional. After going outside walking around San Jose, it's nice to come to a place you feel safe. Moreover, if you want lots of room, a safe, the sound of a soothing fountain and close to breakfast, request room #1. The free punch drink you receive upon arrival will knock your socks off...Pura Vida!
reviews.title: Clean/Safe/Friendly

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Don Carlos for one night earlier this month. Found our room to be very clean and quiet. Staff were also friendly and helpful. Great breakfast included and nice giftshop located in the hotel. Also, had a great dinner at Bakea restaurant located a five minute walk away. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night with our 2 teens. We really liked the character the hotel has. The food was good, the staff very friendly and the kids loved the free internet access. We also appreciated the free 5 minute long ditance phone call the hotel gives you upon check-in. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The gift shop was ok but a little pricey. We will stay here again on our return trip to CR.
reviews.title: Nice ,clean and safe
Unique Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Don Carlos in San Jose Costa Rica. This hotel is in a beautiful old mansion and makes you feel like you are in another time and place in the past. It is also centrally located in the downtown area. The staff was very helpful and spoke english fluently. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated with antique wheels, paintings, and ornate furntiture. The courtyard area was exquisitely laid out with tile, tiled fountain, and stylish sitting area. The rooms are large and clean. The private bathrooms are very well decorated and large. There is also free internet access for guests in the sitting area and a free secure parking garage to put your car in overnight. I would reccomend staying here for the ambiance, services, location, and price.

It's clean and the location convenient, and with lots of rooms probably always has availability. But for only a few dollars more the rooms at the Grano de Oro are infinitely nicer, with much nicer furnishings and much more comfortable beds.
reviews.title: acceptable
